verses.kjv: And Naomi had a kinsman of her husband’s, a mighty man of wealth, of the family of Elimelech; and his name was Boaz.
verses.ct: Now Naomi had a relative on her husband's side, a man of considerable wealth and influence from Elimelech's family. His name was Boaz.

verses.kjv: And Ruth the Moabitess said unto Naomi, Let me now go to the field, and glean ears of corn after him in whose sight I shall find grace. And she said unto her, Go, my daughter.
verses.ct: Ruth the Moabite said to Naomi, "Please let me go out to the fields and pick up leftover grain behind whoever will show me kindness." Naomi replied, "Go ahead, my daughter."

verses.kjv: And she went, and came, and gleaned in the field after the reapers: and her hap was to light on a part of the field belonging unto Boaz, who was of the kindred of Elimelech.
verses.ct: So she went out and began gathering leftover grain in a field behind the harvesters. As it happened, she ended up in the section of land that belonged to Boaz, who was from Elimelech's family.

verses.kjv: And, behold, Boaz came from Bethlehem, and said unto the reapers, The LORD be with you. And they answered him, The LORD bless thee.
verses.ct: Just then, Boaz arrived from Bethlehem and greeted the harvesters, "May the LORD be with you!" They called back, "May the LORD bless you!"

verses.kjv: Then said Boaz unto his servant that was set over the reapers, Whose damsel is this?
verses.ct: Boaz asked his foreman who was supervising the harvesters, "Who is that young woman?"

verses.kjv: And the servant that was set over the reapers answered and said, It is the Moabitish damsel that came back with Naomi out of the country of Moab:
verses.ct: The foreman answered, "She's the Moabite woman who came back with Naomi from the land of Moab."

verses.kjv: And she said, I pray you, let me glean and gather after the reapers among the sheaves: so she came, and hath continued even from the morning until now, that she tarried a little in the house.
verses.ct: "She asked permission to gather leftover grain among the bundles behind the harvesters. She's been on her feet working since early this morning, only resting briefly in the shelter."

verses.kjv: Then said Boaz unto Ruth, Hearest thou not, my daughter? Go not to glean in another field, neither go from hence, but abide here fast by my maidens:
verses.ct: Boaz said to Ruth, "Listen to me, my daughter. Don't go gather grain in anyone else's field. Don't leave this place. Stay here close to my female workers."

verses.kjv: Let thine eyes be on the field that they do reap, and go thou after them: have I not charged the young men that they shall not touch thee? and when thou art athirst, go unto the vessels, and drink of that which the young men have drawn.
verses.ct: "Watch which field they're harvesting and follow along behind them. I've instructed the young men not to bother you. Whenever you get thirsty, go to the water jars and drink what the workers have drawn."

verses.kjv: Then she fell on her face, and bowed herself to the ground, and said unto him, Why have I found grace in thine eyes, that thou shouldest take knowledge of me, seeing I am a stranger?
verses.ct: Ruth dropped to her knees and bowed low to the ground. She said to him, "Why have you been so kind to me and taken notice of me when I'm just a foreigner?"

verses.kjv: And Boaz answered and said unto her, It hath fully been shewed me, all that thou hast done unto thy mother in law since the death of thine husband: and how thou hast left thy father and thy mother, and the land of thy nativity, and art come unto a people which thou knewest not heretofore.
verses.ct: Boaz replied, "I've been told everything about what you've done for your mother-in-law since your husband died — how you left your father and mother and your homeland to come live with people you didn't know before."

verses.kjv: The LORD recompense thy work, and a full reward be given thee of the LORD God of Israel, under whose wings thou art come to trust.
verses.ct: "May the LORD repay you for what you've done. May you receive a full reward from the LORD, the God of Israel, under whose wings you have come to find refuge."

verses.kjv: Then she said, Let me find favour in thy sight, my lord; for that thou hast comforted me, and for that thou hast spoken friendly unto thine handmaid, though I be not like unto one of thine handmaidens.
verses.ct: She said, "May I continue to earn your kindness, my lord. You have comforted me and spoken warmly to your servant, even though I'm not even equal to one of your servant girls."

verses.kjv: And Boaz said unto her, At mealtime come thou hither, and eat of the bread, and dip thy morsel in the vinegar. And she sat beside the reapers: and he reached her parched corn, and she did eat, and was sufficed, and left.
verses.ct: When it was time to eat, Boaz told her, "Come over here and have some bread, and dip your piece in the wine vinegar." She sat down with the harvesters, and he offered her some roasted grain. She ate until she was full and still had some left over.

verses.kjv: And when she was risen up to glean, Boaz commanded his young men, saying, Let her glean even among the sheaves, and reproach her not:
verses.ct: When she got up to continue gathering grain, Boaz gave his workers orders: "Let her pick up grain even among the bundled sheaves, and don't give her any trouble."

verses.kjv: And let fall also some of the handfuls of purpose for her, and leave them, that she may glean them, and rebuke her not.
verses.ct: "In fact, pull out some stalks from the bundles on purpose and leave them for her to pick up. Don't say a word to stop her."

verses.kjv: So she gleaned in the field until even, and beat out that she had gleaned: and it was about an ephah of barley.
verses.ct: So Ruth gathered grain in the field until evening. When she threshed out what she had collected, it came to about an ephah of barley.

verses.kjv: And she took it up, and went into the city: and her mother in law saw what she had gleaned: and she brought forth, and gave to her that she had reserved after she was sufficed.
verses.ct: She carried it back to town, and her mother-in-law saw how much she had gathered. Then Ruth pulled out the leftover food she had saved from lunch and gave it to her.

verses.kjv: And her mother in law said unto her, Where hast thou gleaned to day? and where wroughtest thou? blessed be he that did take knowledge of thee. And she shewed her mother in law with whom she had wrought, and said, The man’s name with whom I wrought to day is Boaz.
verses.ct: Her mother-in-law asked her, "Where did you gather grain today? Where did you work? May God bless the man who took notice of you!" Ruth told her mother-in-law who she had worked with, saying, "The man I worked with today is named Boaz."

verses.kjv: And Naomi said unto her daughter in law, Blessed be he of the LORD, who hath not left off his kindness to the living and to the dead. And Naomi said unto her, The man is near of kin unto us, one of our next kinsmen.
verses.ct: Naomi said to her daughter-in-law, "May the LORD bless him! He has not stopped showing his kindness to the living and the dead." Then Naomi told her, "That man is a close relative of ours — one of our family redeemers."

verses.kjv: And Ruth the Moabitess said, He said unto me also, Thou shalt keep fast by my young men, until they have ended all my harvest.
verses.ct: Ruth the Moabite added, "He also told me, 'Stay close to my workers until they've finished all of my harvest.'"

verses.kjv: And Naomi said unto Ruth her daughter in law, It is good, my daughter, that thou go out with his maidens, that they meet thee not in any other field.
verses.ct: Naomi said to Ruth her daughter-in-law, "That's wonderful, my daughter. It's best for you to go out with his female workers so that no one bothers you in some other field."

verses.kjv: So she kept fast by the maidens of Boaz to glean unto the end of barley harvest and of wheat harvest; and dwelt with her mother in law.
verses.ct: So Ruth stayed close to Boaz's female workers, gathering grain through the end of both the barley harvest and the wheat harvest. She continued living with her mother-in-law.
